p: Echinacea purpurea is widely used in pharmaceutical, food, cosmetics and health industries. Although it is not native to Iran, it has been introduced to native Iranian plants in recent years. It has antifungal, anti-bacterial, and anti-viral properties and is used to prevent and treat colds, bronchitis, lung infections, cutaneous disorders and chronic immune response deficiencies (Bauer et al., 1988 ▶). In recent years, the antimicrobial properties of this plant were recognized and attributed to the presence of phenolic compounds (Hu and Kitts, 2000 ▶).
